result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse E. Taylor

records.addlTxt: Intake Report- Marathon County Pretrial Services  - Completed 10-13-2022

Case Called: 9:14 a.m. 
Clerk Heather.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant FAILS to appear, with Atty Joseph Kaupie in person.

Atty Kaupie indicates his client has been in the hospital for the past week and requests the COURT to not issue a warrant and forfeit bond.
COURT holds BFH in abeyance, leaves PTC on and requires proof of hospital visit.

DATES to remain.

Adjourned: 9:16 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on November 16, 2022 at 10:20 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: INCLUDES 22CM919 & 22CF751.  No contact with victim C.M.B. unless waived in writing at the DAs office.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 9:32 a.m. 
INCLUDES: 22CM919, 22CF751.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski; Defendant appears in person with Atty Joseph Kaupie.
Date and time set for an indigency hearing.

Defendant has obtained counsel and requests a warrant quash.
Atty Kaupie makes statement re: missed appearance, requests the warrant to be quashed in both cases.
COURT QUASHES WARRANTS.
ADA Vechinski makes bond arguments.
COURT addresses parties.
COURT orders $1,000.00 signature bond to cover both files with same conditions as originally ordered, vacates forfeiture of prior bond.
Atty Kaupie requests his appointment to be extended to the 22CM919 file. 
Defendant sworn in and testifies. 
Court finds defendant indigent;
COURT appoints Atty Joseph Kaupie @ $100/hr not to exceed $1,000.00 to cover both files, w/o further order;

DATES:
CC: 10/12/22 @ 1:00 p.m. 

Adjourned: 9:45 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse E. Taylor
Current: 416-1/2 S 4Th Av, Wausau, WI 54401   (Effective: 09-22-2022)
Prior: 416-1/2 2 S 4Th Av, Wausau, WI 54401

Case Called: 10:30 am
INCLUDES 22CF751 & 22CM919.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry in person. Defendant does not appear. Atty Joseph Kaupie appears in person on behalf of the Defendant.
VRCW.
Date and time set for a Jury Status Hearing.
Defendant has received notice of today's hearing.
State is requesting a Bench Warrant and a Bond Forfeiture due to the Defendant's non appearance.
Court Authorizes BW $1,000 to cover both files.
BFH: 10/21/2022 @ 9:00 am
Adjourned: 10:32 am

No contact with victim C.M.B. unless waived in writing at the DAs office.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

2:01 p.m.
Clerk Micki. 

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde for ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears in custody from the MCJ via Zoom video, with Attorney Peter Vu.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY. 

COURT ORDERS: $500.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): C.M.B. unless waived in writing at the DA's office.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
